title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "HEROES Act of 2005" includes death gratuity enhancements, with a $100,000 payment for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or designated operations. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuities for combat-related deaths and designated operations, with adjustments to the amounts and additional gratuity for deaths before the effective date. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuities for combat-related deaths and designated operations, with adjustments to the amounts and additional gratuity for deaths before the effective date. In the case of a member of the Armed Forces who died before the enactment of this Act as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom, the Secretary of the military department concerned shall pay a death gratuity in addition to the one payable under existing laws. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuities for combat-related deaths and designated operations. The additional death gratuity for Operation Iraqi Freedom-related deaths is $238,000, payable to beneficiaries entitled under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code. The additional death gratuity amount is calculated based on the regular military death gratuity payable to beneficiaries. Definitions include the additional death gratuity and regular military death gratuity under title 10, United States Code. SEC. 3. SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE ENHANCEMENTS. Increased Maximum Amount Under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 or lesser amount chosen by member, with additional coverage for certain members. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is increased to $400,000 for members serving in certain areas or operations, with additional coverage for those who die as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred while serving in designated combat operations or zones. The additional amount of insurance for a member serving in designated areas is $150,000, but it may be reduced if the member already has insurance exceeding $250,000. The total insurance payable for a member cannot exceed $400,000. During service in designated areas, the cost of $150,000 insurance coverage for a member is covered and cannot be deducted from their pay. Funding for this insurance is determined by the Secretary and contributed from the appropriation made for active duty pay. The cost of Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is certified to the Secretary concerned as $150,000. Amendments are made to increase insurance coverage to $400,000 and clarify coordination with Veterans' Group Life Insurance. Amendments to Section 1967(a) of the title require notice to be given to a member's spouse regarding their election not to be insured or to be insured for a lower amount. Additionally, a member with a spouse cannot choose to not be insured or be insured for a reduced amount under this subchapter. Amendments to Section 1967(a) of the title require notice to be given to a member's spouse regarding their election not to be insured or to be insured for a lower amount. A member with a spouse may not modify the beneficiary designated under subsection (a) without the spouse's written consent. These changes will take effect more than 90 days after the enactment of this Act.
